title: The 10 hard lessons I learnt after buying a listed house
text:
Owning a listed home is, for many people, the ultimate property fantasy – a chance to live in an architecturally striking house where every nook and cranny is suffused with history and intrigue. For some, the dream is a chocolate-box thatched cottage; for others, it’s huge expanses of brutalist concrete.

Georgian buildings have always had my heart and, in the spring, my husband and I were fortunate enough to buy one – a former steam mill in Suffolk dating from the 1820s.

My, but it’s handsome: warm red bricks, original sash windows, panelled doors and lofty ceiling heights. Golly it’s expensive, though, for everything from insurance to heating bills to the cost of works. Plus, the regulations...
description: Owning a listed home is, for many people, the ultimate property fantasy – a chance to live in an architecturally striking house where every nook and cranny is suffused with history and intrigue.
